alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Watauga County through 500 PM EDT... At 416 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beech Mountain, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boone... Beech Mountain... Foscoe... Sugar Grove... Deep Gap... Todd... and Beech Mountain In Avery County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
